result.execSummary:
The defendant Brett C. Landru was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brett C. Landru appears via video from FOSO, in custody.  Called 3:15 PM. FTR recorded. Landru asks for extention once released from jail. Court orders payment plan of $70/month, commencing 2/15/17.
Payment hearing on October 18, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brett C. Landru in court with attorney William Allen Dickens.  Defendant Brett C. Landru in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:40 AM. Called 15CF139, 15CM225 and 16CF07. State - 15CM225 is resolved. Dickens - plead to only count as alleged with a $300.00 fine plus costs and surcharges. State and Landru agree. Landru pleads NC to count #1. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State - follow joint recommendation. Dickens - follow joint recommendation. Landru makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: $300.00 fine plus costs and surcharges - 60 DTP/CO, submit DNA charges, right to appeal. Court will set other two matters for JT on 10/20/16, backing up another JT.
Final pre-trial on July 12, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Defendant's reply to state's demand for discovery
Final pre-trial on May 25, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Brett C. Landru in court with attorney William Allen Dickens.  Defendant Brett C. Landru in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:05 PM. Also called 16CF07, 16CF08 and 15CM225. State - believes there will be a waiver of PH on 16CF07 and 15CF139 and has filed Information for both of those cases that mirrors the complaint in anticipation of that. Dickens and Landru agree and provides Court with waiver of PH form. Court goes thru waiver of PH forms, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, finds probable cause on both cases, binds over for trial on both cases. Dickens has Information for both of those cases, waives reading of both of those, will proceed to ARGN on both of those cases and enters NG pleas to all counts on those two cases. Court accepts NG pleas on both of those cases. State will proceed with PH on 16CF08 (2:11 PM). State amends count #1 on the complaint prior to proceeding with PH - 940.149(1) - misd battery with repeater component contrary to 939.62(1)(a) and remaining counts to remain as charged. Dickens and Landru have o objections to that amendment. Court amends count #1 on 16CF08 to misd batter as PTAC to 940.149(1) with PTAC contrary to 939.62(1)(a). State offers exhibit #1 - bond form from 15CF139. Court receives after no objections (2:13 PM) and takes judicial notice of it. State calls Robert Munday. Munday sworn in at 2:14 PM. Direct exam by State. Record reflects proper identification of the defendant (2:16 PM). State offers exhibit #2 - witness statement. Court receives exhibit #2 after no objections (2:25 PM). Cross edam by Dickens at 2:27 PM. Re-direct by State at 2:33 PM. Munday excused at 2:34 PM. Dickens will stipulate to venue. Court accepts that venue is stipulated to. Dickens calls Joshua Fox. Fox sworn in at 2:35 PM. Direct exam by Dickens. Fox excused at 2:45 PM. Recess at 2:45 PM. Back on record at 2:46 PM. State moves to dismiss charges in 16CF08. Dickens has no objections. Court dismisses 16CF08 entirely. Off record for scheduling. Back on receord at 2:48 PM. Court continues bond on all matters and sets all matters for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 25, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on April 5, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Brett C. Landru in court with attorney William Allen Dickens.  Defendant Brett C. Landru in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:08 PM. Also called 16CF07, 16CF08 and 15CM225. Dickens and defendnat have all complaints, waives reading of all of them, wants PH but Attorney Dickens calendar will not allow for the PH within the time limits and will waive the time limits for that. Courts sets felony cases for PH on 4/5/16 at 2:00 PM and misd. manners will follow as STC, court continues bond on all matters.  Status conference scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Requesting furlough. Faxed to Judge Rhode.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved
